'''"Cosmo" Singh''' was the son of [[Gretchen McKay]] and [[Omar Singh]].


Cosmo was born via emergency c-section in a hospital hallway at  weeks. During the delivery, he lost about half his blood volume. After his birth, he was rushed to the NICU, where he struggled to breathe. He was put on ECMO as a last-ditch effort to save his life. It was unsuccessful and he died in the NICU.



Cosmo's family was in a car accident when his mom was pregnant with him. He and his mother both died as a result of the accident.


*Cosmo was not his name, just what his parents called him while they were expecting him, because he was conceived under the influence of cosmopolitans.

'''Annie Banks''' is a woman who came into the hospital after falling into razor wire.


Annie was trying to remove the razor wire that surrounded her house when she fell back onto it, seriously injuring herself. She and her husband had built the wall and razor wire was on shortly after moving into the house, as they didn't trust other people. However, after he died, she decided to take it all down. At the hospital, she was unconscious and hypothermic, which the wire wrapped around her whole body. The wire was wrapped around her leg, cutting off blood flow. When she woke up in the hospital, she panicked and started moving around, further injuring herself. They gave her haldol to calm her down. They then took her to surgery, where they did vascular repair and had to amputate her leg below the knee. When she was told about what had happened, she said she and her husband had built the wall because they didn't trust people and she was trying to take it down because it felt like it was trapping her in. She was pleased to have gotten out.



She was married until her husband died.


*She was  at the time of her accident.

'''August Endris''' is a baby who was born with hypoplastic left heart syndrome.


After Gus was born, [[Dr. Hundley]], who had delivered him, heard a heart murmur, so she called for a consult. After tests and a cardio consult, Gus was diagnosed with hypoplastic left heart syndrome. Nathan wanted to put Gus on the transplant list, but Alex wanted to try a Norwood. Because they disagreed, they talked to Gus's parents about both options. However, Nathan secretly put Gus on the transplant list before they had decided. When a heart became available before they had decided, Nathan told the parents and they consented to the heart transplant. After his surgery, Gus was stable.


*His mom liked the name August and his dad liked Leo. They flipped a coin to decide his name.

'''Bryan''' is the father of [[Diego (In the Air Tonight)|Diego]].


Bryan and his wife, [[Marisela]], were on their first family trip with their son, Diego, a last-minute decision. Because of this, they hadn't been able to get seats together. After talking to Marisela, Meredith, who was in a row with Marisela and Diego, offered to trade seats with Bryan so the family could sit together. They gratefully accepted.

Shortly after take-off, the plane hit severe turbulence, causing luggage to fall from the overhead compartment. Bryan and Marisela tried to block it, but it hit Diego, cutting his forehead. After the turbulence settled, the three doctors on board went around checking on the passengers who had been injured. [[Harrison Peters]] bandaged Diego's forehead and Meredith told him he might need a few stitches in it.



He is married to [[Marisela]].

'''Bryan''' is the father of [[Matt (The Road You Didn't Take)|Matt]].


Bryan's son, Matt, came out to his parents as transgender and told them his new name was Matt. Bryan immediately accepted him and tried to help him, while his mother, Jane, refused to and continuously deadnamed and misgendered him. His parents ultimately divorced over his mother's refusal to accept him and his father was granted sole custody of him. His father took him and moved to Seattle with him, but his mother tracked his phone and came to Seattle with her new husband, where she tried to take Matt back with her. She and Bryan argued over it and a neighbor overheard and called the police to report a domestic disturbance. Crisis One responded and Vic and Theo, along with social worker [[Clarke Wright]], found Bryan and Jane outside yelling at each other. Jane told them that Bryan had kidnapped their child from her house in Florida in the middle of the night and she'd tracked her child's phone to find them. Suddenly, Matt appeared from inside the house and told his mother that his name was Matt. Things heated up when Jane's new husband, [[Randall]], arrived and Matt begged them not to make him go with his mom and Randall. Meanwhile, Clarke and [[Officer Marinis]] established that Bryan had recently been granted sole custody of Matt, meaning he didn't have to go with his mother. Matt went to talk to his dad, but as he did so, his mom grabbed him and forced him into Randall's truck. Then Randall climbed in and attempted to drive away. Vic, Clarke, Theo, and Officer Marinis immediately stepped in to stop him. Matt was returned to his father and Jane and Randall were arrested. Jane told Matt to tell them it was all a mistake, but he just said that he was sad that his mother wouldn't get to know the man he was becoming. Theo suggested that Bryan consider relocating and changing their phones so Jane couldn't find them again, because he knew that she was unlikely to change her mind. They also offered the station's support going forward and Clarke gave them brochures for other resources they could access.



He was married to [[Jane (The Road You Didn't Take)|Jane]] until they divorced over her refusal to accept their son after he came out as transgender.


He has a son, Matt, whom he supported after Matt came out as trans.


*He and his son live at  Mulberry Drive.

'''Candace''' is a flight attendant whose wrist was broken during a turbulent flight.


Candace was attending a flight out of Seattle when the flight hit severe turbulence, breaking her wrist and injuring several other passengers. Nathan checked on her and told her her wrist was broken. She got into the medical kit, but there was no brace, so he had to reset her wrist and then wrap it until they could land and get proper medical care.

Candace helped them treat the other patients while they waited for clearance to land somewhere. Once they'd landed, she was told to follow-up with her regular doctor about her wrist.



After they landed, she flirted with Nathan, asking if she should call him for a follow-up, but Nathan brushed her off.


She is a flight attendant. Her route services Seattle.

'''Captain LeVantine''' is the pilot who was flying a plane that hit severe turbulence, injuring several passengers.


While flying out of Seattle, the plane LeVantine was piloting hit severe turbulence, which injured multiple passengers, including flight attendant [[Candace]], and [[Max]], who had a brain bleed. Despite this, she was unable to land because they were flying with a storm above and below them, which made landing very risky to the other passengers.

After getting through the storm, LeVantine was cleared for an emergency landing in Sioux Falls. Once they were on the ground, all the passengers de-planed and those who needed immediate care were met by ambulances. LeVantine found Meredith and shook her hand and told her it had been a pleasure flying with her.


She is a pilot.

'''Clarke Wright''' is a social worker and new member of Crisis One.



Clarke met Theo and Vic at  Mulberry Drive and informed them that a neighbor had called in a domestic dispute. They found [[Jane (The Road You Didn't Take)|Jane]] and [[Bryan (The Road You Didn't Take)|Bryan]] arguing over their child. Jane told them Bryan had come to her house in Florida and taken their child in the middle of the night. She'd tracked their child's phone to find them. Suddenly, the child appeared and said his name is [[Matt (The Road You Didn't Take)|Matt]], contrary to what Jane had said. Bryan told them that Matt had come out to them a few years prior and while Bryan accepted him and helped him, Jane refused and continued to deadname him, which led to their divorce. Then [[Randall]], Jane's new husband, arrived and Matt begged them not to make him go back. Clarke investigated and found that Bryan had recently been granted full custody of Matt. However, when Matt went to talk to his dad, Jane and Bryan grabbed him and forced him into Randall's truck and prepared to drive away. Clarke, along with Vic, Theo, and Officer Marinis, stopped them from leaving. Jane and Randall were arrested and Matt was returned to his father. Jane tried to get Matt to tell them it was all a mistake, but Matt just said he was sad his mother wouldn't get to know the man he was becoming. Clarke then gave Matt and Bryan informational brochures for resources they could access. ''("[[The Road You Didn't Take]]")''


Clarke later accompanied Ben and Maya when they went to the Dixons home after a neighbor called to complain about them fighting. When they learned that Dixon had left, Clarke stood guard outside in case he returned while Ben and Maya talked to Kitty. When he did return, he forced his way inside and insisted everything was okay. Kitty and Dixon fought some more, leading to Kitty throwing a vase at her husband's head, cutting his forehead. Despite this, they both insisted they were fine, so Clarke wrote up the incident report and the three of them left. ''("[[Dancing With Our Hands Tied]]")''


Clarke responded to a parking structure when mall staff called Crisis One to report [[Raphael]] on the roof, drinking and acting erratically. Andy and Clarke tried to talk to him and convince him to come down, but they were unable to get him safe until they learned he was needed at another scene to save eight workers at his battery plant who were trapped. Hearing that his people were in trouble startled him and he moved too suddenly, slipping off the edge. Sullivan, who was in a harness, dove and caught him. Clarke then helped Andy lower them to the next floor, where Andy pulled them to safety. ''("[[Pick Up The Pieces]]")''


Clarke is a social worker and he's also a volunteer member of Crisis One.

'''Daphne''' was a patient whose chemo port became infected.


Daphne was in the hospital after having surgery to have her liver mets removed. While she was in the hospital, she continuously studied because she was close to graduating with honors. She was set to be discharged, but Meredith noticed that the area around her chemo port was red, indicating infection. She examined the area and found signs of infection, so she removed the port. However, the area then started bleeding severely. Meredith applied pressure to the area and gave her clotting factors. [[Nathan Riggs]] was called in because of the location of the port. He wanted to take her to surgery, but Meredith said they were going to hold pressure and wait to see if she'd clot on her own.

They ran labs, which showed septicemia. Because of this, they started to prepare for a possible move to the OR. Meredith told Daphne that if she moved her hand and it started bleeding, they'd have to rush her into surgery. They then told Daphne that she needed to call [[David]], despite her insistence that she didn't want to call him until she had done something she could be proud of. She called David and he agreed to come to the hospital to see her. When Meredith removed her hand, Daphne started bleeding, so Meredith re-applied pressure and they rushed Daphne to an OR, leaving a trail of blood behind them. However, despite their best efforts, they were unable to save her. When David arrived at the hospital, he was taken to see her body.



Daphne put other things ahead of her son, David, and that led to her leaving him when he was fourteen. She later contacted him on the day of her death and he agreed to come see her.


She worked two jobs in addition to going to school.

'''Darcie''' is a woman who stabbed a man who attacked her in a park.


Darcie was running in the park when a man attacked her. She pulled out the knife she was carrying and stabbed him repeatedly with it, then she walked to Station  to get help. Officers [[Officer Reaser|Reaser]] and [[Officer Marinis|Marinis]] came to the station to interview her about what had happened. She explained and when she became distressed, they asked for her to be moved to the hospital for an exam and a psych evaluation. Officer Marinis rode in the ambulance with her. On the way to the hospital, she talked about how she never thought it would happen to her. She never ran during the night or in secluded areas, because she always saw reports of people being assaulted and wondered why they'd run at night.



Her mother gave her a knife when she moved to the city. She later used the knife to stab a man who attacked her while she was running in the park.

'''David''' is the son of [[Daphne]].


David's mother, Daphne, chose many things over him, which resulted in her leaving him when he was fourteen. By the time he was twenty, he had another mother raising him and Daphne was working hard to be the kind of person who deserved to have David in her life. She was nearing graduation and had fought cancer, but didn't want to call until that was all over because she didn't want to call him when she still had problems. When she started seriously bleeding when her chemo port was removed, the doctors told her she needed to call David. She called him and he agreed to come to the hospital. However, by the time he arrived, she had died in surgery. He was then taken to see her body.



His mother, Daphne, put other things ahead of him and that led to her leaving him when he was fourteen. She later contacted him on the day of her death and he agreed to come see her.

After he was taken away from Daphne, he got a new mother, according to Daphne.


*He was  at the time of [[Daphne|Daphne's]] death.

'''Devin''' is a worker who was trapped at the Arkine Battery Recycling Plant.


Devin was melting old batteries down to recycle them when something malfunctioned and he and seven other workers became trapped in the room with the batteries, which were releasing harmful chemicals. [[Liz]], a co-worker, called for help, and firefighters started working to get oxygen into the room. When one of the workers indicated there was acid in the room, the firefighters had them lie down on the ground. Their efforts to breach the walls were fruitless until they were table to track down the engineer, [[Raphael]], and get him to the plant. Once the door was open, the workers were evacuated. Devin was given oxygen, but had a seizure from the exposure. They were able to stabilize him and got him to the aid car to take him to the hospital.


He works at Arkine Battery Recycling Plant.

'''Diego''' is a child who was injured by falling luggage during turbulence.


Diego was on his first family trip with his parents. He didn't like being on the plane and cried, upsetting nearby [[Lance]]. Meredith stepped in and asked Lance to stop being a jerk about it and then offered to switch seats with Diego's father, [[Bryan]], so the family could sit together as they hadn't been able to get seats together due to their last-minute booking.

After they were in the air, the plane hit severe turbulence, which resulted in luggage falling on Diego's head and cutting him on the forehead. After the turbulence settled, the three doctors on board went around checking on people who had been injured. [[Harrison Peters]], a dentist, bandaged Diego's head, but Meredith later told him he might need a couple stitches.



He and his family were on their first trip together.

'''Eric''' is the husband of [[Sonia]].


During the pandemic, Eric's wife, Sonia, started having an affair with her neighbor, [[Matthew (Comfortably Numb)|Matthew]]. One day, while she was at his place, someone entering the apartment made her believe his girlfriend had come home. She jumped out a window onto what she thought was a fire escape only to fall three stories into a dumpster after hitting her back on the edge of it. Jack and Inara found her soon afterward and called for an ambulance. She tried to refuse, saying calling an ambulance would ruin her life. She admitted to Jack and Inara that she'd been having an affair and an ambulance would mean her husband would find out about the affair. Jack climbed into the dumpster with her and talked to her as a tingly sensation made its way up her body, affecting her limbs. He warned her of a possible spinal injury and impressed upon her the importance of going to the hospital. While she talked about the mess she'd made of her life, her husband, Eric, arrived and overheard her talking. He was upset at her having an affair and got into a fight with Matthew over it. Soon after that, the firefighters arrived and pulled Sonia out of the dumpster and took her to the hospital. Jack later reported that her spine wasn't severed, just bruised.



He is married to [[Sonia]], though she is having an affair with their neighbor.


*During the pandemic, he and his wife had their groceries delivered on Tuesdays and a virtual game night on Fridays.

'''Gayle McColl''' is the estranged wife of [[Griffin McColl]].


Gayle's husband, Griffin, had run his car into an electrical pole. He had an intracranial bleed as well as being electrocuted. While he had brain surgery on the bleed, Nathan inserted a pacemaker to regulate his heartbeat. After his surgery, they told [[Lena]], whom they believed was his wife, about his condition. However, Gayle arrived and informed them that she was Griffin's wife and Lena was just his girlfriend. Griffin was worth a lot of money and so Gayle refused to divorce him due to a pre-nuptual agreement that meant she wouldn't get his money unless they were married when he died.

Griffin woke up after his surgery, confused and believing that he and Gayle were still together. He was shocked that they weren't and had no memory of Lena or their relationship. While they were talking about their life together, Griffin started to go weak. Penny examined him and found that his ICP was increasing. She did a ventriculostomy in his room and then he was rushed into surgery for a re-bleed. Despite their best efforts, he died in surgery.



She was married to [[Griffin McColl]] until his death, though they'd been separated for  years. She says that he was sweet and then his money turned him into someone she couldn't love. When he woke up after his surgery, he had memory loss that made him forget that they'd ever split. He called her the funniest woman he'd ever met. After his brief time conscious after surgery, she realized she loved him and just wanted a chance to love him again. However, he died in a second surgery.


*According to Griffin, she has the softest hands.

'''Gretchen McKay''' is a patient who came into the ER after a car accident.


Gretchen and her family were brought to the ER after being in a car accident. Gretchen was more concerned with her husband and children's safety than her own. She had some abdominal pain, so she was taken into the ER, where her BP dropped. It came back up when they rolled her onto her side, so they propped her up that way. Arizona came in to examine her and said they both looked good, but she ordered a CT just to be safe. [[Jasmine Singh|Jasmine]] came in to see her while she waited, showing her Spencer's lost tooth. Gretchen told Jasmine she was in charge. The CT was clear, so Ben and Andrew prepared to move her up to OB. On the way, Gretchen started to complain of additional pain, so they propped her up even higher. A [[Hospital Codes#Code Pink|Code Pink]] was called, blocking them in the hallway just as they lost the fetal heartbeat. Ben had Andrew find a crash cart, which he then used to do a c-section in the hallway. After he had the baby delivered, Bailey found them. She stepped in to help Andrew stop Gretchen's bleeding while Ben took the baby to the NICU. Gretchen was rushed to the OR, where Arizona operated to try to stop the bleeding. Despite her best efforts, Gretchen was pronounced dead in the OR.



She was married to [[Omar Singh]] until her death.


She and her husband had three kids and were expecting a fourth. The fourth was delivered while they were hospitalized, but died shortly after Gretchen herself.

'''Harrison Peters''' is a pediatric dentist who helped treat patients who were injured during a turbulent flight.


Harrison was on a flight out of Seattle when they hit severe turbulence, injuring several passengers. He went around helping treat patients, despite being a pediatric dentist. He said it was nice to work on adults as typically, the craziest things he sees are kindergarteners with teeth growing in behind their teeth. He bandaged a cut on [[Diego (In the Air Tonight)|Diego's]] forehead and helped Meredith drain blood off [[Max|Max's]] skull when she diagnosed a brain bleed. After they made an emergency landing, Harrison walked toward Meredith, but was interrupted by Meredith being greeted by the Captain.


He is a pediatric dentist.


*He has nail clippers on his key chain.

'''Ingrid''' is a passenger who was sitting with Nathan and Meredith during the turbulence.


Ingrid was seated between Meredith and Nathan during their flight. When she noticed them talking to each other, she asked if they wanted to trade to sit next to each other. Nathan said yes, but Meredith told her no. After the two of them went to the bathroom together and returned, they saw that Ingrid had moved over, leaving them two seats together.

Shortly after this, the plane hit turbulence. Once it had stopped, Meredith and Nathan left their seats to start treating people who were injured. Ingrid was upset that they were leaving her alone, but Nathan put her oxygen mask on her and told her to breathe.

Later, Ingrid came to Nathan upset that he hadn't come back. She had a cut on her shoulder, which he cleaned for her. She then started helping them treat other patients, despite being squeamish. She helped successfully treat Max's brain bleed with Meredith.


*She hates flying.

'''Jane''' is the mother of [[Matt (The Road You Didn't Take)|Matt]].


Jane came from Florida to Seattle with her husband, Randall, with the intent of kidnapping her son and bringing him back to Florida with them. The son, Matt, had come out to his parents as transgender a few years prior, which led to their divorce because his father supported him while his mother did not. Their argument drew the attention of a neighbor, who called the police. Crisis One responded and Jane told them that Bryan, her ex-husband, had kidnapped their child from her home in Florida and she'd tracked Matt's phone to find them. A police officer, [[Officer Marinis]], got involved and they determined that Bryan had recently been granted full custody of Matt, meaning he wouldn't have to go back with his mother. Matt then went to go inside to talk to his father, but Jane grabbed him and forced him into Randall's truck. As Randall prepared to drive away, Clarke, Vic, Theo, and Officer Marinis forced him to stop and got Matt out of his truck and back to his father. Randall and Jane were then arrested. Jane begged Matt to tell them it was a misunderstanding, but Matt just said he was sad for her that she wouldn't get to know the man he was becoming.



She was married to [[Bryan (The Road You Didn't Take)|Bryan]], but they divorced after she wouldn't accept that their son is trans. She later married [[Randall]].


She has one son, Matt, but refuses to accept him and continuously deadnames him.

'''Jasmine Singh''' is the daughter of [[Gretchen McKay]] and [[Omar Singh]].


Jasmine was in a car accident with her parents. While both parents were in critical condition, Jasmine and her two brothers, Trevor and Spencer, had only minor injuries. When their mother died, Bailey came to tell the kids they'd be spending the night at the hospital because their father was still in critical condition. Jasmine asked to talk to Bailey in the hallway, where she figured out that their mom had died. She then asked Bailey for money to play Tooth Fairy for her brother, who had just lost a tooth. ''("[[There's a Fine, Fine Line]]")''

Bailey told Jasmine that her grandma would be coming to the hospital. Omar still had a long recovery ahead, but it was looking good because he was waking up. She took Jasmine to see him, but when they got to his room, he was seizing. Jasmine's grandma, [[Mira Singh|Mira]], arrived at the hospital shortly after and was told she could sign papers to make him DNR or to continue resuscitation attempts. Jasmine said he wouldn't want to live in a bed, so Mira signed the DNR papers. Bailey ignored the DNR when Omar didn't have more seizure activity and after resuscitation, Omar started to improve and eventually woke up asking about his wife and baby. ''("[[It's Alright, Ma (I'm Only Bleeding)]]")''



Her whole family was in a car accident. Her mother and baby brother died as the result of the accident, which also left her father in critical condition. She and her other brothers had only minor injuries. ''("[[There's a Fine, Fine Line]]")''

Her father survived his injuries and began to recover. ''("[[It's Alright, Ma (I'm Only Bleeding)]]")''

'''Jay''' is the fianc\ue of [[Max]].


Jay and his fianc\ue, [[Max]], were flying out of Seattle when their flight hit severe turbulence and Max hit his head hard on the ceiling of the cabin. He was rendered unconscious and lay in the aisle of the plane while Jay tried to rouse him. After the turbulence settled, Meredith ran to help him and he regained consciousness, but was still confused about what had happened. She could feel a skull fracture and suspected he could possibly have a brain bleed. She asked Jay if he knew Max's medical history or medications he took. Jay showed them his pill holder and Nathan noticed that he was taking blood thinners, meaning if he had a brain bleed, it wouldn't stop. But there was nothing they could do on the plane and it wasn't safe to land, so they bandaged his head and got him back in his seat, where his confusion subsided.

Max later started vomiting and then seized. Meredith diagnosed an epidural bleed and searched the plane for anything they could use to drain the blood. She found a single syringe and moved Max to an area of the plane where they cleared out the other passengers and put him in a seat. Harrison ventilated him and kept his head steady while Meredith inserted the needle to drain the blood. When she realized how risky it was to keep reinserting the needle, she decided to disconnect the syringe each time instead. When Nathan was called away for another emergency, [[Ingrid (In the Air Tonight)|Ingrid]] stepped in and screwed and unscrewed the syringe for Meredith. Because it wasn't working fast enough, Meredith decided to clip the end of the needle off and place a cocktail straw into the hole to drain the blood more quickly. Once they landed, Meredith wrote details of his case in a paper and taped it to Max's chest before he was loaded into an ambulance and taken to the hospital.



He is engaged to [[Max]].


He and Max fought over how Max and Jay's family didn't get along.

[[SFD Station ]]
'''Former'''
US Navy |first appearance = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[With or Without You]] *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Born to Run]] |last appearance = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Things We Lost in the Fire (Grey's Anatomy)|Things We Lost in the Fire]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]] and [[Season (Station )|]] |portrayed by = [[Drew Rausch]] }} '''John Finch''' is the boyfriend of [[Evelyn Hunt]], Owen's mother. He is a firefighter working at [[SFD Station ]]. John met his future girlfriend, Evelyn, at a writers group. She wrote stories about her time in Vietnam, which fascinated John who'd been in the Navy himself. They stayed to talk afterward and six months later, they were still together. John was with Evelyn at her house when she fell in the shower. He'd been making her breakfast because she felt dizzy and he thought it was just because she needed to eat. He accompanied her to the hospital and stayed by her bedside. However, when Evelyn's son, Owen, found out about them, he didn't approve and felt that John was just scamming her. Evelyn had only minor injuries, so they kept her overnight to observe her. John went to her house to take care of the cat and take out the recycling and brought her clothes and a new journal because he couldn't find hers. However, she felt compelled to break up with him because her son didn't like him. Shortly after the breakup, Evelyn had severe abdominal pain. She was rushed into surgery for a ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm. John, despite having been dumped, refused to leave the hospital until he knew that she was okay. He sat in the waiting room with Owen while Evelyn was in surgery. When he found out she was okay, he prepared to leave, but before he left, he told Owen that a book he'd ordered for Evelyn was at her house and asked him to make sure she got it. This made Owen realize that John really cares about Evelyn and the two got back together. ''("[[With or Without You]]")'' A fire broke out on Mt. Baker and John was called to the scene. While fighting the fire, he sustained burns to his chest. He slipped and fell in a ravine and was impaled on a metal pole. In the ER, [[Nathan Riggs]] pulled out the pole. There was a hole in his pericardium, which he was taken into surgery to repair. After his surgery, he was expected to make a full recovery. ''("[[Things We Lost in the Fire (Grey's Anatomy)|Things We Lost in the Fire]]")'' When [[Rigo Vasquez]] was injured, John was moved to A-shift to cover the gap. Since he was close with Rigo, Maya checked with him to make sure he could be professional despite what had happened with Jack and Eva. He insisted he could. They were then called out to a vehicle accident in which a truck hit several people on motorcycles. On the scene, John was directed to check on the truck driver, who was drunk and unresponsive. John determined that he was essentially already dead, so Maya had him swap places with Emmett, so Emmett could learn how to do a difficult intubation in the field without the risk of killing someone who had a chance to live. ''("[[Born to Run]]")'' After Rigo's death, John blamed Jack and expressed his desire to hurt Jack because of it. When he found A shift in the beanery, he said they needed to get out before he hurt Jack. ''("[[Something About What Happens When We Talk]]")'' John was present when [[Darcie]] came into station after stabbing a man who assaulted in as she ran in the park. When the officers who responded suggested taking Darcie to the hospital, Jack and Dean offered to do that, despite being off-shift, as John pointed out. ''("[[Bad Guy]]")'' When [[Sonia]] fell three stories into a dumpster, John came from station to get her out and to the hospital. While he was there, he took a jab at Jack, who was in the dumpster with her, asking if he was in his element. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")'' He is dating [[Evelyn Hunt]], who is several years his senior. The two met at a writers group. He loved her stories about her time in Vietnam, so he stayed after to talk to her about them. When they noticed they were the only two left, he asked her to get coffee. She said that six months later, they hadn't run out of the things to talk about. He didn't mind the age difference, saying that they were just years and frankly, years he wished he'd spent with her. She also said that when they kissed, the years between them melted away. When Evelyn was hospitalized after an accident, John fed the cat, took the recycling out, and brought her clothes and a journal. Despite this, she dumped him briefly after her son, Owen, didn't approve of them. However, John refused to leave the hospital until he knew she was okay, so he sat in the waiting room and waited. After he found out she was okay, he went to leave, but first told Owen that he'd ordered a book Evelyn had been looking for and it was in her house. That led Owen to see that John really cares for Evelyn and John and Evelyn got back together. ''("[[With or Without You]]")'' He did a stint in the US Navy, which drew him to Evelyn's stories about her time in Vietnam. He is currently a firefighter with the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. He has been working the B-shift at [[SFD Station ]] for a while. When [[Rigo Vasquez]], having recently transferred to A-shift, sustained an injury on the job, John subbed for him on A-shift. *He was at the time of Evelyn's hospitalization. *He doesn't speak during his [[Things We Lost in the Fire (Grey's Anatomy)|second appearance]] on [[Grey's Anatomy]]. xJohnFinch.png|[[With or Without You]] xJohnFinch.png|[[Things We Lost in the Fire (Grey's Anatomy)|Things We Lost in the Fire]] SxJohnFinch.png|[[Born to Run]] SxJohnFinch.png|[[Something About What Happens When We Talk]] SxJohnFinch.png|[[Bad Guy]] SxJohnFinch.png|[[Comfortably Numb]] {{John Finch Appearances}} [[fr:John Finch]] [[de:John Finch]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Finch, John}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]] [[Category:Patients (Cardio)]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (Plastics)]] [[Category:Firefighters]]

'''Kamal Aboud''' is a boy from Jordan who had serious tumors invading his hands.



Kamal was living in Jordan. He had to watch his entire family being killed and would have been taken as a child soldier, except that his hands were deformed. His home was burned down, so he lived in the hospital in Jordan, where the doctors gave him odd jobs.


[[Nathan Riggs]] later brought him to Seattle in order for him to have surgery to repair his hands. When [[Jackson Avery]] saw his hands, he saw that the tumors were much worse than anticipated. He looked at the scans and said it was too complex to attempt. Nathan wanted to take Kamal to another hospital, but Jackson said they'd all say the same thing. He agreed to run a biopsy. When the biopsy revealed pre-cancerous cells in both hands, he officially recommended amputation of both hands.

They told Kamal they'd be amputating his hands, but once they took him into surgery, they started working on removing the tumors and finding usable bone. They were able to remove the tumors and find enough bones to reconstruct his hands. After surgery, he was excited to see that his hands looked like hands. He was told he'd need a few more surgeries, but he'd keep his hands.



He witnessed his whole family being murdered.


While living in the hospital in Jordan, he became close with the doctors, particularly [[April Kepner]] and [[Nathan Riggs]].


*To get to Seattle, he rode a bus, a plane, a train, three cars, and a helicopter.

'''Kate Endris''' is the mother of [[August Endris]].


After Kate's son, Gus, was born, [[Dr. Hundley]], who had delivered him, heard a heart murmur, so she called for a consult. After tests and a cardio consult, Gus was diagnosed with hypoplastic left heart syndrome. Nathan wanted to put Gus on the transplant list, but Alex wanted to try a Norwood. Because they disagreed, they talked to Gus's parents about both options. However, Nathan secretly put Gus on the transplant list before they had decided. When a heart became available before they had decided, Nathan told the parents and they consented to the heart transplant. After his surgery, Gus was stable.



She is married to [[Mr. Endris]].


Her son, Gus, was born with hypoplastic left heart syndrome.

'''Lance''' is a man whose pulmonary hypertension caused him to be unable to breathe on the plane.


Lance was upset to be seated near a child, [[Diego (In the Air Tonight)|Diego]] on his flight. He said he had pulmonary hypertension and had forgotten to take his water pill that morning, meaning flying was uncomfortable for him. Meredith told him that wasn't an excuse to treat mothers like that. He returned to his seat and shortly after, the plane hit turbulence. When he saw Meredith treating patients, he asked if she knew if they would be landing on time, because he had a tight connection to make. She handed him a bag and told him to breathe into it and sit down.

Later, he struggled to breathe due to his condition, so Nathan stepped in to help him. He got EDs from [[Janis (In the Air Tonight)|Janis]] and gave them to Lance, but then Lance went into cardiac arrest. Dave got the defibrillator and Nathan used it on Lance several times unsuccessfully, so he continued CPR. While the pilot was making an emergency landing, Nathan was finally able to restore sinus rhythm. Several ambulances met the plane to take the injured to the hospital.


*His bag had to be gate-checked.
*He likes sitting on the aisle.

However, [[Gayle McColl]] then arrived and informed them that she was his wife. They were still married, but had split years before and he had been seeing Lena.

She was worried about him, but unable to get more information about his condition because he wasn't family and Gayle asked her to leave. When Griffin woke up after his first surgery, he had no memory of Lena or their relationship. He believed he was still with Gayle. He later had to have a second surgery, during which he died.



She dated [[Griffin McColl]] for the last eleven years of his life.

'''Liz''' is an employee of a battery recycling plant.


Liz worked at a factory that melted down old batteries to recycle them. One morning, the engineer, [[Raphael]], didn't come to work, but the management told her to start the process anyway, even though he was the only person capable of overriding the system. When something went wrong, trapping eight workers in a room that was filling with acid. Liz called for help. Station  responded and she explained the situation, saying they had no way of overriding the system and all the doors and windows were reinforced to prevent people outside from being exposed to the chemicals inside. While Theo and Vic attempted to get a vent on the roof, Maya and Travis tried to cut through the doors. When Ross realized the missing engineer was the subject of a Crisis One call, she had them bring him to the plant, where he used his palm print to open the doors, allowing them to evacuate the workers. Once they were outside, they were given oxygen. Liz felt guilty for starting the process without Raphael, even though management had made the call to do so. When she saw Raphael, she apologized for starting without him. He told her it wasn't his fault and promised to spend the time he had left making it right.


She works at Arkine Battery Recycling Plant.

'''Lloyd''' is a man who was injured when he jumped off an ice resurfacer.


Lloyd and his wife, Suzie, own and operate an ice rink. Even while they were shut down to the pandemic, Lloyd insisted on doing his daily laps in the ice resurfacer. One day, while he was working, hydraulic fluid leaked and started a fire, which quickly engulfed the whole vehicle. Suzie saw that it was on fire and told Lloyd to get off. He jumped, injuring himself and leaving him stranded on the ice, while the resurfacer continued to run around the ice, turning when it ran into the sides of the rink. Suzie called for help and the fire department quickly arrived.

Maya sent Sullivan out to evaluate Lloyd and then sent Travis and Vic out with a stokes basket to retrieve him. Once he was off the ice, they started treating him. Then they stood outside the rink at the edge and sprayed the ice resurfacer with water every time it got close to the edge. After some time, it started to slow down, so Suzie gave Sullivan, Jack, and Vic skates and helmets and they went out on the ice, chasing the ice resurfacer and spraying it until the fire was put out. Suzie then drove Lloyd to the hospital, wanting to avoid the large bill of an ambulance ride.



He is married to [[Suzie]].


He and his wife own and operate Double L Ice Rink. They never had any children, so she says the rink was like their baby.


*The actors who play him and his wife ([[John Billingsley]] and [[Bonita Friedericy]]) are married in real life.

'''Matt''' is a teen boy whose parents were at odds over him.


Matt came out to his parents as transgender and told them his new name was Matt. His father immediately accepted him and tried to help him, while his mother refused to and continuously deadnamed and misgendered him. His parents ultimately divorced over his mother's refusal to accept him and his father was granted sole custody of him. His father took him and moved to Seattle with him, but his mother tracked his phone and came to Seattle with her new husband, where she tried to take Matt back with her. She and Bryan argued over it and a neighbor overheard and called the police to report a domestic disturbance. Crisis One responded and Vic and Theo, along with social worker [[Clarke Wright]], found Bryan and Jane outside yelling at each other. Jane told them that Bryan had kidnapped their child from her house in Florida in the middle of the night and she'd tracked her child's phone to find them. Suddenly, Matt appeared from inside the house and told his mother that his name was Matt. Things heated up when Jane's new husband, [[Randall]], arrived and Matt begged them not to make him go with his mom and Randall. Meanwhile, Clarke and [[Officer Marinis]] established that Bryan had recently been granted sole custody of Matt, meaning he didn't have to go with his mother. Matt went to talk to his dad, but as he did so, his mom grabbed him and forced him into Randall's truck. Then Randall climbed in and attempted to drive away. Vic, Clarke, Theo, and Officer Marinis immediately stepped in to stop him. Matt was returned to his father and Jane and Randall were arrested. Jane told Matt to tell them it was all a mistake, but he just said that he was sad that his mother wouldn't get to know the man he was becoming. Theo suggested that Bryan consider relocating and changing their phones so Jane couldn't find them again, because he knew that she was unlikely to change her mind. They also offered the station's support going forward and Clarke gave them brochures for other resources they could access.



When he came out, his father supported him, while his mother continued to deadname him and misgender him. His parents ultimately divorced over the issue and his father was granted sole custody of him.


*He and his father live at  Mulberry Drive.

'''Matthew''' is the man [[Sonia]] cheated on her husband with.


Matthew had a girlfriend, but was also having an affair with his neighbor, [[Sonia]]. One day, they were at his place hooking up because his girlfriend was out of town, when someone coming into the apartment scared them. Believing his girlfriend had returned, Sonia went out a window, believing it was a fire escape, but fell three stories into a dumpster. Matthew came down soon afterward to check on her and told her it was not his girlfriend but the dog walker who had let himself in, believing they were out of town. Matthew was confronted by Sonia's husband, [[Eric]], and they got into a physical fight. Firefighters arrived, broke up the fight, and got Sonia out of the dumpster and to the hospital, where she learned that her spine was just bruised, not severed.



He has a girlfriend and is having an affair with [[Sonia]].

'''Max''' is a passenger who hit his head on the ceiling during turbulence, causing a brain bleed.


Max and his fianc\ue, [[Jay]], were flying out of Seattle when their flight hit severe turbulence and Max hit his head hard on the ceiling of the cabin. He was rendered unconscious and lay in the aisle of the plane while Jay tried to rouse him. After the turbulence settled, Meredith ran to help him and he regained consciousness, but was still confused about what had happened. She could feel a skull fracture and suspected he could possibly have a brain bleed. She asked Jay if he knew Max's medical history or medications he took. Jay showed them his pill holder and Nathan noticed that he was taking blood thinners, meaning if he had a brain bleed, it wouldn't stop. But there was nothing they could do on the plane and it wasn't safe to land, so they bandaged his head and got him back in his seat, where his confusion subsided.

Max later started vomiting and then seized. Meredith diagnosed an epidural bleed and searched the plane for anything they could use to drain the blood. She found a single syringe and moved Max to an area of the plane where they cleared out the other passengers and put him in a seat. Harrison ventilated him and kept his head steady while Meredith inserted the needle to drain the blood. When she realized how risky it was to keep reinserting the needle, she decided to disconnect the syringe each time instead. When Nathan was called away for another emergency, [[Ingrid (In the Air Tonight)|Ingrid]] stepped in and screwed and unscrewed the syringe for Meredith. Because it wasn't working fast enough, Meredith decided to clip the end of the needle off and place a cocktail straw into the hole to drain the blood more quickly. Once they landed, Meredith wrote details of his case in a paper and taped it to Max's chest before he was loaded into an ambulance and taken to the hospital.



He is engaged to [[Jay]].


*Jay teases him for having a day-of-the-week pill holder.

'''Mira Singh''' is the mother of [[Omar Singh]].


Mira came to the hospital after her son and daughter-in-law were in an accident with their children. She was told that because Omar had had a seizure, he might have suffered permanent brain damage. With [[Jasmine Singh|Jasmine's]] help, she decided to sign a DNR order for Omar. His condition declined, but when he went into v-tach, Bailey ignored the DNR and resuscitated successful. Mira was confused and asked Bailey if that meant Omar had a chance. Hours later, Omar started to improve and woke up asking about his wife and baby.



She has a son, Omar, and four grandchildren, one of whom is deceased.

'''Mr. Endris''' is the husband of [[Kate Endris]] and father of [[August Endris]].


After Mr. Endris's son, Gus, was born, [[Dr. Hundley]], who had delivered him, heard a heart murmur, so she called for a consult. After tests and a cardio consult, Gus was diagnosed with hypoplastic left heart syndrome. Nathan wanted to put Gus on the transplant list, but Alex wanted to try a Norwood. Because they disagreed, they talked to Gus's parents about both options. However, Nathan secretly put Gus on the transplant list before they had decided. When a heart became available before they had decided, Nathan told the parents and they consented to the heart transplant. After his surgery, Gus was stable.



He is married to [[Kate Endris]].


His son, Gus, was born with hypoplastic left heart syndrome.

{{Quote|The first time I saw you, you were at the OR board. You were talking with Pierce and she said something that made you laugh and I couldn't move. And then I had to wait for you to write your name on the board because I just needed to know who you were. So I don't have a good reason for you to like me, I didn't even try to like you, I didn't want to. And I certainly don't wanna have to think about you all the time, trying to come in early see your name on the board. Come up with that one thing that's gonna make you smile so your eyes do that thing they do. Anyway, that's why I joke so much and to keep from having to say anything like this. So I don't have a good reason, sorry I wish I did.|'''Nathan Riggs''' to '''[[Meredith Grey]]'''}}

'''Nathan Riggs''' is a cardiothoracic surgeon who worked with [[April Kepner]] during her time in Jordan. After bringing a patient to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], he got a job working there but eventually resigned when he moved to Malibu with\ua[[Megan Hunt]].



Nathan was born in New Zealand. At the age of , he moved to Seattle.


Owen and Nathan became doctors together, including their field training. They became like brothers, and Nathan really trusted him. <ref>[[All I Want is You]], x</ref> Through Owen, Nathan met [[Megan Hunt]], with whom he fell in love. They started a relationship, but they both cheated on each other. While they were working as field surgeons in Iraq, Megan found out he had cheated and called her brother<ref>[[I Wear the Face]], x</ref>, who urged her to get away from Nathan as soon as possible.<ref>[[Trigger Happy]], x</ref>


That same day, Nathan and Megan needed to transport a patient from the field, but there was only room in the chopper for one of them. It was going to be an ugly ride through an unprotected airspace, so he wanted to go. Megan objected as she wanted to get away from Nathan and pointed out it was her patient. After a fight, he let her go as he would've done the same thing had the patient been his. The helicopter never arrived at its destination and disappeared without a trace. Megan's disappearance started the feud between Owen and Nathan, as Owen blamed him for it.<ref>[[My Next Life]], x</ref> After her disappearance, Nathan stayed around for a while to look for her, while Owen returned to Seattle soon after her disappearance.<ref>[[I Am Not Waiting Anymore]], x</ref>


While working with April, he and the other doctors called her "''The Machine''" because she worked through everything and made others want to work harder. Because of April, Nathan came to Seattle with [[Kamal Aboud]], who needed surgery to remove tumors from his hands. Jackson initially refused and Nathan started calling around to find another surgeon. While doing so, he encountered Owen, who urged to him to leave. Since all other surgeons refused, Jackson decided to amputate, but changed his mind mid-procedure and saved Kamal's hands. At the end of the day, Nathan went to Joe's with April and Bailey, who wanted to hear war stories.<ref>[[The Me Nobody Knows]], x</ref>


Following their night out, Bailey offered Nathan a job at the hospital. She neglected to consult with anyone before hiring Nathan, thus surprising Maggie and Owen to see him at work. At the end of his first day, he asked Meredith to go grab a drink together, but she declined, as she decided to hate Nathan because Owen did so.<ref>[[Something Against You]], x</ref> The news of the feud between Owen and Nathan spread quickly around the hospital, and rumors of possible causes soon followed. Nathan focused on his job and ignored Owen's constant attempts to thwart him. When Owen's mother showed up at the hospital for [[John Finch|John]], Nathan saw her and they hugged. Owen later told him to stay away from his family, to which Nathan responded he viewed [[Evelyn Hunt|Evelyn]] as his family, too. Owen then punched him and told him they were not his family. Afterwards, Nathan went to Joe's and bought Amelia a drink.<ref>[[Things We Lost in the Fire (Grey's Anatomy)|Things We Lost in the Fire]], x</ref>

Owen continued to interfere with Nathan doing his job, even going as far as to throw him off a shared case. Nathan hung out with April at the bar and told her how he met Owen, and that he never hated him. However, when the patient was in distress, Owen specifically requested Nathan for help, and their colleagues witnessed how amazingly in sync they were able to work, anticipating each other's moves and knowing what to do without any conversation. While scrubbing out, the men began yelling at each other again.<ref>[[All I Want is You]], x</ref> While working together with Meredith, she acted rather hostile when he tried to smoothen things with personal questions, but at the end of the day asked him about his deal with Owen. Since she only knew about Megan's helicopter disappearing, Nathan told her that he had wanted to board the chopper, but Megan insisted on going herself.<ref>[[My Next Life]], x</ref>

When Owen confronted him again about clashing opinions over a shared patient, Nathan flat-out told him to find someone else to hate in order to get over his guilt. He reminded Owen that while he stayed to look for Megan, Owen gave up and returned to Seattle.<ref>[[I Am Not Waiting Anymore]], x</ref> Not long after, Owen, Nathan, and Meredith got on an ambulance to retrieve a heart. Nathan learned that Amelia was an alcoholic and confessed he bought her a drink. Owen started to yell at him, but Meredith broke up the fight. Later that day, Owen told Nathan bad things happen around him, and he told Nathan he knew about the cheating. He told Nathan he couldn't come to the hospital and pretend to be a hero and fool everyone, as Owen would not let that happen.<ref>[[I Wear the Face]], x</ref> After Maggie became aware of the reason of Owen's severe disliking of Nathan, Nathan opened up to Maggie and told her that despite Owen telling everyone he's a liar, the only thing he did was leave pieces out of the story since he considered those to be just for him and Megan. He admitted to having made a big mistake, but he's paid for it ever since it happened.<ref>[[It's Alright, Ma (I'm Only Bleeding)]], x</ref>

The feud seemingly came to a truce on the day of Owen and Amelia's wedding. Since April, Owen's best man, ended up in the hospital, Nathan drove down to the church to give Owen the rings. Owen thanked him and invited him to stay for the ceremony.<ref>[[Family Affair]], x</ref>


When Meredith had a bad day, he confronted her about it in the parking lot, realizing it was all about Amelia and how she was living the life that Derek didn't get to live. They started arguing and she suddenly jumped him when he asked her what she wanted. They ended up having sex in her car, four times.<ref>[[At Last]], x</ref>\uaWhen Nathan brought it up a few weeks later, Meredith stated she didn't want him to get too attached to her. He claimed he knew they were just friends who had sex, but during Owen and Amelia's wedding, he smilingly looked at her, indicating he started to feel more for her.<ref>[[Family Affair]], x</ref> After the wedding, Nathan continuously chased Meredith, hoping to be friends or something more, but she repeatedly rejected him due to knowing her sister, [[Maggie Pierce]], would get hurt. However, after accidentally meeting up on a plane and getting closer, the two became a couple.


After Meredith told Nathan that Megan had been found and was being transported to Seattle, Nathan rushed to the hospital to be reunited with his long-lost fianc\uee. Nathan attempted to restart his relationship with Megan by re-proposing to her, but she turned him down because she believed that he was still in love with Meredith. Nathan subsequently tried to get back together with Meredith, but she told him to make a grand gesture to win Megan's affection because it's not every day that people gets a second chance with a lost loved one. Nathan traveled overseas and brought back [[Farouk Shami Hunt|Farouk]], Megan's son, who was stuck in Iraq, proving his love for Megan. Nathan and Megan then got back together and [[Megan and Nathan's House|moved]]\uato Malibu together, resulting in Nathan's resignation from Grey Sloan.


In early , Nathan and Megan split up after the sitting at home during the pandemic made them realize they were not happy together. As soon as they agreed to break up, Nathan signed back up with his NGO and he shipped out two days later.


When Nathan first came to the hospital with [[Kamal Aboud]], he seemed like a very nice guy. He and April get along very well, and Kamal deeply cared about him. Owen, however, feels completely different about Nathan. He resents Nathan and doesn't even want to be near him. He passed on his hatred to Meredith, who began to notice that Nathan overstepped his boundaries and made rash decisions, like when he decided to pull a spike out of a man's chest. This is likely due to the fact that Nathan had been doing relief work in the Middle East for a long time, a place where he had to take initiative, and was not yet adjusted to the ways of a real world hospital.



[[Megan Hunt]]
Nathan was romantically involved with Megan Hunt, Owen's younger sister. One day, while working in a field unit, they had to transport a patient across unprotected airspace, with the chopper only having room for one of them. After some fighting, Nathan allowed Megan to step on board, as the patient was hers. The chopper, however, disappeared without a trace, which lead to Owen blaming him for her supposed death hence their current feud.

However, Owen revealed to Meredith that Nathan was never near the chopper with Megan. He revealed that Nathan cheated on Megan with another woman.<ref>[[I Wear the Face]], x</ref> Nathan later confirmed this when confronted by [[Maggie Pierce]] and said that everything he told Meredith was true; he just left out the part about the cheating because he considers it to be only for himself and Megan. He does not owe anyone an explanation of this, and Maggie agrees.

While Owen was taking care of baby Harriet, he and Nathan had a conversation about kids. Owen asked if Nathan and Megan ever discussed having children, and Nathan said that they did talk about it. Megan wanted to name their child Bernard, which he and Owen shared a laugh about. Nathan sadly went on to say that the universe had other plans for Megan.<ref>[[Both Sides Now]], x</ref>

When Megan was found and brought back to Seattle, Nathan proposed to her to rekindle their romance. However, she turned him down because she thought that he was still in love with Meredith. After getting advice from Meredith, Nathan made a big gesture for Megan by bringing her son back from Iraq. Megan finally believed that Nathan wanted to be with her, and they both departed Seattle to begin a life together in California.

After a few years filled with therapy to work on their relationship, it ended up one of the casualties of the pandemic. They realized they were a couple that enjoyed high highs and low lows and staring at the same four walls for a year while people were dying around them made them realize they were not meant to live together.

[[Meredith Grey]]
Nathan and Meredith were initially at odds, with her disliking him out of loyalty for Owen. Due to Owen's stories, she began to notice he was prone to making rash medical decisions, and their opinions quite often differed. However, she has shown to be able to put her dislike aside so it won't affect patients, or when Nathan told her his side of the story. When Meredith had a bad day, he confronted her about it in the parking lot. They started arguing and ended up having sex in her car.<ref>[[At Last]], x</ref>\uaIt happened four times, but Meredith didn't want him to get too attached to her. He claimed he knew they were just friends who had sex, but during Owen and Amelia's wedding, he smilingly looked at her, indicating he had started to feel more for her.<ref>[[Family Affair]], x</ref>

Later at the wedding, Nathan and Meredith flirted and he asked her to dance, only for Maggie to interrupt and dance with him, leaving Meredith to watch the two. Nathan continued to try to get closer to Meredith, and although she liked him, she kept brushing him off as she knew Maggie liked him too. Finally, Nathan showed up at Meredith's house, verbally confirming his feelings for her. Meredith lied to him, saying she didn't return the feelings, out of consideration for Maggie.<ref>[[Undo]], x</ref>\uaMeredith also warned Nathan that Maggie was going to ask him out, which Nathan believed to be the reason she was rejecting his pursuits. Nathan still wanted to be more than friends with Meredith, but out of loyalty to her sister, she continued to ignore him.<ref>[[Catastrophe and the Cure]], x</ref>\uaMeredith asked Nathan to a dinner date, but cancelled on him last minute as she had to care for Maggie, who was grieving after the death of\ua[[Diane Pierce]], her mother.<ref>[[What's Inside]], x</ref>
[[File:x-.jpg|thumb|xpx|Nathan and Meredith at a press conference]]
Meredith and Nathan found themselves sitting next to each other on a plane, both heading to a conference. Meredith went to the bathroom, but Nathan followed her, intent on talking to her about their situation. They ended up having sex. After the plane landed and passengers were tended to, Nathan proposed that they get a hotel room and Meredith accepted.<ref>[[In the Air Tonight]], x</ref> A few weeks later, Meredith walked out of the hospital while holding hands with Nathan, indicating they are officially a couple.<ref>[[Leave It Inside]], x</ref>

With Megan returning, Meredith and Nathan's relationship was rocky. Nathan proposed to Megan, but she turned him down, believing he was still in love with Meredith. He told Meredith about that at the end of the day, but she just walked away from him.<ref>[[Get Off on the Pain]], x</ref> Meredith avoided Nathan out of anger, but when they later had a conversation, she revealed that she felt he was betraying her by not getting back together with Megan. When Nathan and Meredith had first started dating, they bonded over losing a loved one. Meredith believed that Nathan must seize the opportunity to have a second chance with Megan. If he didn't, then he wasn't the man Meredith thought he was. Nathan eventually moved to Malibu with Megan, effectively ending his relationship with Meredith for good.


[[Owen Hunt]]
Nathan met Owen and Megan in med school and became friends with Owen, who became like a brother to him. Owen was supposed to be his best man at his wedding with Megan. They were torn apart, however, after Megan disappeared in the field with the helicopter she was on and Owen began blaming Nathan for having allowed her to step on board. They did not see each other for years until Nathan came to the hospital with April Kepner. When he was hired as a cardiothoracic surgeon, Owen quickly began to bad-mouth him and punched him upon his notion that the two of them shared a family. They continued to share parts of the story, confusing their colleagues. On the day of Owen's wedding, Nathan brought the rings to the church since April ended up in the hospital. Owen appreciated the gesture and invited him to stay for the ceremony, thus marking a truce in the feud.<ref>[[Family Affair]], x</ref>

[[Evelyn Hunt]]
Nathan and Evelyn appear to be on good terms, with her hugging him warmly upon meeting him again after his arrival to Seattle, and him calling her "ma". It seems that she, unlike her son, has forgiven Nathan for whatever part he had to play in her daughter's fate.<ref>[[Things We Lost in the Fire (Grey's Anatomy)|Things We Lost in the Fire]], x</ref> At Owen and Amelia's wedding, Nathan sat next to her while she admired her soon-to-be daughter-in-law.<ref>[[Family Affair]], x</ref>


[[April Kepner]]
During their time working together in Jordan, he became close with April Kepner, whom he often calls "Keps". They remain good friends at Grey Sloan, as seen when they were playing darts at Joe's and talking to each other about their personal problems.<ref>[[All I Want is You]], x</ref>


[[Maggie Pierce]]
Maggie was surprised to find out that Bailey hired someone for her department without consulting<ref>[[Something Against You]], x</ref>, but she soon came to realize Nathan was talented and not a bad guy. After the panel convened for [[Ben Warren|Ben's]] actions on [[Gretchen McKay]], Nathan noticed Maggie was acting differently and he figured she heard Owen's stories about him. He told her that everything he had told Meredith was true, but he admitted to leaving out some pieces that he considered just for him and Megan. Maggie understood and went back to treating him normally.<ref>[[It's Alright, Ma (I'm Only Bleeding)]], x</ref>\uaOver time, Maggie developed a crush on him, but Nathan didn't notice it and just maintained a pleasant professional relationship with her. Pierce asked Nathan out, but Meredith had warned him about this and had told him to say no. Riggs did so due to his growing feelings for Meredith, but felt bad hurting Maggie.

[[Amelia Shepherd]]
Nathan and Amelia maintain a professional relationship. After he bought her a drink, he became aware of her romantic relationship with Owen and once offered to go talk to a patient's family without her so she could make her date with Owen.<ref>[[Odd Man Out]], x</ref> Nathan appears to keep a distance from her in his personal life since she's close to Owen, so he figured she'd have formed her conclusions about him already.


Riggs is an [[Attending|attending]] [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeon]], formerly working at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. He graduated from [[Harvard Medical School]], and he was a candidate for [[Attending#Department Head|head]] of [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgery]] at [[Duke University Medical Center]] prior to [[Chief of Surgery|Chief]] [[Miranda Bailey|Bailey]] hiring him.

He resigned at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital when he moved to Malibu. He applied for jobs in Los Angeles but it's unknown where exactly he works now.

He worked alongside the Army for years while doing relief work\uain the Middle East.


*As an [[Attending|attending]], Riggs wears a personal scrub cap. It is red themed with subtle etchings of a darker shade.
*Nathan has a habit of calling the morgue a "plumber", a habit he picked up on the field and is now trying to get rid of.<ref>[[Trigger Happy]], x</ref>
*Nathan likes bacon, and he often brings it to work as a snack.<ref>[[At Last]], x</ref>
*He once re-inflated a collapsed pulmonary artery on a dirt road with a straw and a set of car keys.
*He drives a black Range Rover Sport with license plate EVK-.<ref>[[At Last]], x</ref>
*With the exception of [[Cristina Yang]], Nathan Riggs is the first cardiothoracic surgeon who is not the department head to play a major role in any season.
*When he was a teenager, he and his friend managed to fly a crop duster in the air for four minutes before it crashed into a shed.
*Albeit not a Department Head, Nathan joins the list of cardiothoracic surgeons who left Seattle Grace Hospital or the hospitals established in the building later after only a couple of seasons: [[Preston Burke]],\ua[[Erica Hahn]],\ua[[Virginia Dixon]], and\ua[[Teddy Altman]].
*He doesn't know how to play baseball.<ref>[[Danger Zone]], x</ref>

'''Officer Marinis''' is a police officer.



Officers Marinis and Reaser responded to a call when Station  informed them there was a stabbing victim in Humboldt Park. They interviewed the woman who had stabbed him, [[Darcie]]. She explained that he had attacked her from behind, grabbing her ponytail, and she stabbed him in self-defense. When she became distressed, they decided to have her moved to the hospital so she could be examined and evaluated. Officer Marinis rode with her in the ambulance to the hospital. ''("[[Bad Guy]]")''


When [[Lloyd (Here It Comes Again)|Lloyd]] fell on the ice and needed help, Marinis and Reaser came to the ice rink to see if the fire department needed any backup. Maya told them the scene was contained and they didn't need any help. They said they'd tell dispatch not to send anyone else. ''("[[Here It Comes Again]]")''


Marinis came to the home of [[Matt (The Road You Didn't Take)|Matt]] and [[Bryan (The Road You Didn't Take)|Bryan]] when [[Jane (The Road You Didn't Take)|Jane]] claimed that Bryan had come to her home in Florida and kidnapped Matt in the middle of the night to get him away from her. [[Clarke Wright]] informed them that Bryan had been granted sole custody and Marinis said that kidnapping charges against him were being dropped. ''("[[The Road You Didn't Take]]")''


She is a police officer with the Seattle Metropolitan Police Department.


*She's most likely named after [[Meg Marinis]], a writer for [[Grey's Anatomy]].

'''Omar Singh''' is a patient who came into the ER after a car accident.


Omar had taken off his seat belt to reach for a book his son had dropped when they were in a car accident. They were rushed to the hospital, where Omar had severe abdominal bleeding. When a [[Hospital Codes#Code Pink|Code Pink]] was called while he was in a trauma room, they prepared to do a thoracotomy in the ER, but the Code Pink was lifted before that became necessary and he was taken into an OR for surgery. ''("[[There's a Fine, Fine Line]]")''

After his surgery, he went into cardiac arrest and was put on therapeutic hypothermia. He was breathing spontaneously and started to wake up, but then he started seizing. The seizure left him without oxygen prolongedly. When his mother, [[Mira Singh|Mira]], arrived at the hospital, she was told he might not wake up and if he did, they wouldn't know about possible deficits because there wasn't much brain activity. Mira was told she could sign DNR papers or they could continue to attempt resuscitation. Jasmine overheard and said she should sign the papers, saying he wouldn't want to live in a bed like that and he'd want to be with Gretchen. Mira agreed to sign the papers. Shortly after, Omar started crashing as his condition declined. Bailey said he hadn't had any more seizure activity, so they could give him medication and fluids to help his heart, but Mira declined, saying her son was gone.

When he went into v-tach while his mom and kids were out of the room, Bailey decided to ignore the DNR and defibrillate, which was successful and restored sinus rhythm. Hours later, he started moving and then regained consciousness. He was asking about his wife and baby, but hadn't been told yet that they died. ''("[[It's Alright, Ma (I'm Only Bleeding)]]")''



He was married to [[Gretchen McKay]] until her death.


He and Gretchen had three children and were expecting another. While he was in surgery, their fourth child was born and died at the hospital. ''("[[There's a Fine, Fine Line]]")''


*He was  at the time of his car accident.<ref>[[There's a Fine, Fine Line]], x</ref>

'''Randall''' is the stepfather of [[Matt (The Road You Didn't Take)|Matt]].


Randall came from Florida to Seattle with his wife, Jane, with the intent of kidnapping his stepson and bringing him back to Florida with them. The stepson, Matt, had come out to his parents as transgender a few years prior, which led to their divorce because his father supported him while his mother did not. Their argument drew the attention of a neighbor, who called the police. Crisis One responded and Jane told them that Bryan, her ex-husband, had kidnapped their child from her home in Florida and she'd tracked Matt's phone to find them. A police officer, [[Officer Marinis]], got involved and they determined that Bryan had recently been granted full custody of Matt, meaning he wouldn't have to go back with his mother. Matt then went to go inside to talk to his father, but Jane grabbed him and forced him into Randall's truck. As Randall prepared to drive away, Clarke, Vic, Theo, and Officer Marinis forced him to stop and got Matt out of his truck and back to his father. Randall and Jane were then arrested. Jane begged Matt to tell them it was a misunderstanding, but Matt just said he was sad for her that she wouldn't get to know the man he was becoming.



He is married to [[Jane (The Road You Didn't Take)|Jane]].

'''Raphael''' is an engineer who was in heart failure due to his job.


Raphael went to the top floor of a parking structure with a bottle of gin a week after his best friend's dead. He'd been told he was in heart failure and there was nothing doctors could do to save him. The paring structure was a place he used to go with his dad, where they would watch fireworks and listen to concerts, until his dad died suddenly when he was fourteen. At some point, mall employees saw him and called Crisis One. Andy, Sullivan, and Clarke responded. While Clarke and Andy talked to him, Sullivan prepared the harness. He explained that he was dying and he wanted to do it on his terms rather than waiting for a slow, painful death. Andy tried to connect with him by telling him her mother had faked her death to get away from her and her father. Despite this, her dad would want her to fight if he knew she was sick. Raphael told her there was nothing left to fight for.

Raphael climbed onto the hood of his car and told them about his friend's death. At this point, Ross connected Raphael to a call at his work, where they needed his palm to override the system and free some trapped workers. Andy told Raphael that his people were in trouble and he panicked and moved too quickly, slipping off the edge. Sullivan dove and was able to grab him before he fell. Suspended over the edge, Raphael frantically told Sullivan he didn't want to die like that. With Clarke's help, Andy lowered them down to the next level, where she pulled them to safety. Then they drove Raphael to the plant, where he helped them open the doors.

Once everyone was evacuated, Rachael told his co-worker, [[Liz]], that it was his fault. She said it wasn't his fault, but blamed herself. He said it was the management's fault and he pledged to spend the time he had left making them pay.



His father died in front of him when he was fourteen. After that, his mother told him his father was with God when he became upset over his father's death.


His friend who got him the job at the factory also became ill due to the chemical exposure and died a week before his own suicide attempt.


He's an engineer for Arkine Battery Recycling Plant.

'''Sonia''' is a woman who fell three stories and landed in a dumpster.


During the pandemic, Sonia started having an affair with her neighbor, [[Matthew (Comfortably Numb)|Matthew]]. One day, while she was at his place, someone entering the apartment made her believe his girlfriend had come home. She jumped out a window onto what she thought was a fire escape only to fall three stories into a dumpster after hitting her back on the edge of it. Jack and Inara found her soon afterward and called for an ambulance. She tried to refuse, saying calling an ambulance would ruin her life. She admitted to Jack and Inara that she'd been having an affair and an ambulance would mean her husband would find out about the affair. Jack climbed into the dumpster with her and talked to her as a tingly sensation made its way up her body, affecting her limbs. He warned her of a possible spinal injury and impressed upon her the importance of going to the hospital. While she talked about the mess she'd made of her life, her husband, Eric, arrived and overheard her talking. He was upset at her having an affair and got into a fight with Matthew over it. Soon after that, the firefighters arrived and pulled Sonia out of the dumpster and took her to the hospital. Jack later reported that her spine wasn't severed, just bruised.



She is married to [[Eric]]. Despite this, she was sleeping with [[Matthew (Comfortably Numb)|Matthew]].


*During the pandemic, she and her husband had their groceries delivered on Tuesdays and a virtual game night on Fridays.

'''Suzie''' is the wife of [[Lloyd (Here It Comes Again)|Lloyd]].


Suzie and her husband, Lloyd, own and operate an ice rink. Even while they were shut down to the pandemic, Lloyd insisted on doing his daily laps in the ice resurfacer. One day, while he was working, hydraulic fluid leaked and started a fire, which quickly engulfed the whole vehicle. Suzie saw that it was on fire and told Lloyd to get off. He jumped, injuring himself and leaving him stranded on the ice, while the resurfacer continued to run around the ice, turning when it ran into the sides of the rink. Suzie called for help and the fire department quickly arrived.

Maya sent Sullivan out to evaluate Lloyd and then sent Travis and Vic out with a stokes basket to retrieve him. Once he was off the ice, they started treating him. Then they stood outside the rink at the edge and sprayed the ice resurfacer with water every time it got close to the edge. After some time, it started to slow down, so Suzie gave Sullivan, Jack, and Vic skates and helmets and they went out on the ice, chasing the ice resurfacer and spraying it until the fire was put out. Suzie then drove Lloyd to the hospital, wanting to avoid the large bill of an ambulance ride.



She is married to [[Lloyd (Here It Comes Again)|Lloyd]].


She and her husband own and operate Double L Ice Rink. She says they never had any children, so the rink was their baby.


*The actors who play her and her husband ([[Bonita Friedericy]] and [[John Billingsley]]) are married in real life.
